Q5rhrPV5.question: Which of the following is an advantage of having a trim tank in the horizontal stabiliser?

options.text: It allows the crew to keep the CG at an aft position.
It increases the efficiency of the elevator during slow flight.

mf3BRAI4.question: Some aircraft are equipped with fuel trim tanks located in the aeroplane’s fin or horizontal stabiliser to actively manage CG position. Which of the following is an advantage of having a trim tank in the horizontal stabiliser?

options.text: It allows the crew to keep the CG at an aft position.
It increases the efficiency of the elevator during slow flight.

V14Ehq6Y.question: When the centre of gravity is at the forward limit, an aeroplane will be:

options.text: extremely stable and will require excessive elevator control to change pitch.
extremely stable and require small elevator control to change pitch.
extremely unstable and require excessive elevator control to change pitch.
extremely unstable and require small elevator control to change pitch.
the distance from the datum to the centre of gravity of a mass.
the point on which a lever is supported, balanced, or about which it turns.
the distance from the centre of pressure to the centre of a mass.
the distance from the centre of gravity to the centre of a mass.

GzwWcIfu.question: In cruise flight, a centre of gravity moving aft will:

options.text: have no effect on longitudinal static stability.

tX7NEBA5.question: If the Centre of Gravity of an aeroplane moves forward during flight, the elevator control will become:

options.text: heavier making the aeroplane more difficult to manoeuvre in pitch.
lighter making the aeroplane more easy to manoeuvre in pitch.
heavier making the aeroplane more easy to manoeuvre in pitch.
lighter making the aeroplane more difficult to manoeuvre in pitch.

MXunlr9u.question: Refer to figure or CAP 696 file 2.1. Where is the datum of the aircraft located?

d2BT7UzM.question: An aeroplane is loaded with its centre of gravity towards the rear limit. This will result in:

options.text: a reduction in power required for a given speed.
an increased risk of stalling due to a decrease in tailplane moment.
an increased fuel consumption as a result of increased drag.

gtm00RbU.question: With regard to the CG limits of an aircraft, which of the following is true?

options.text: The aircraft operator’s CG limitations can be more restrictive than the manufacturer’s CG limitations.
It depends on the state of registry whether the manufacturer’s or the aircraft operator’s limitations on CG are more restrictive.
The manufacturer’s CG limitations can be more restrictive than the aircraft operator’s CG limitations.
The CG limitations of the operator always have to be the same as the manufacturer’s limitations.

2l6XsDX2.question: If the centre of gravity is further forward than the forward limit is, the aircraft’s horizontal surfaces have a..

options.text: longer than usual moment arm and the fuel consumption is increased.
shorter than usual moment arm and the range is increased.
longer than usual moment arm and the fuel consumption is decreased.
shorter than usual moment arm and the drag is decreased.

qA8Gdc23.question: If the centre of gravity is further forward than the forward limit is, the aircraft’s horizontal surfaces have a...

options.text: longer than usual moment arm and the fuel consumption is increased.
longer than usual moment arm and the fuel consumption is decreased.
shorter than usual moment arm and the drag is decreased.
shorter than usual moment arm and the range is increased.

zwtoG46w.question: In cruise flight, an aft centre of gravity location will:

options.text: not change the static curve of stability into longitudinal.

nHWJhQkU.question: Which Section of the Aircraft Flight Manual describes the Centre of Gravity limitations?

Yh01Ts72.question: On an aeroplane with its wing tanks filled with fuel and only its centre tank empty, when is the wing load at its maximum?

LFiWLMRZ.question: The effect of the centre of gravity (CG) being close to the forward limit is:

options.text: a decrease of the rate of climb capability.
a reduction in the specific fuel consumption.
a decrease in the induced drag.
an increase of the rate of climb capability.

NmHOL0vF.question: The effect of the centre of gravity (CG) being close to the forward limit is:

options.text: A reduced rate of climb capability.
An improved rate of climb capability.

ItGYfbcD.question: Explain the effect of a centre of gravity (CG) which is in front of the forward limit

options.text: Both the range and the absolute ceiling decrease.
Both the range and the absolute ceiling increase.
The range increases and the absolute ceiling decreases.
The range decreases and the absolute ceiling increases.

yxxFQqsL.question:
Which of the areas listed below fall within the scope of the Basic Regulation (Reg(EC) No 216/2008) on common rules in the field of civil aviation and establishing the European Aviation Safety Agency? 
1. Commercial Air Transport operations
2. Aerodrome operations
3. Unmanned aircraft with an operating mass 150 kg
4. Air Traffic Management organisations.

auDAod6l.question: With regard to the Centre of Gravity limits of an aircraft, which one of the following statements is true?

options.text: The aircraft operator’s CG limitations can be more restrictive than the manufacturer’s CG limitations.
The CG limitations of the operator always have to be the same as the manufacturer’s limitations.
It depends on the state of registry whether the manufacturer’s or the aircraft operator’s limitations on CG are more restrictive.
The manufacturer’s CG limitations can be more restrictive than the aircraft operator’s CG limitations.
Is usually determined by the aircraft manufacturer during weighing at the manufacturing plant and does not include any additional equipment.
Is the mass of an aeroplane as produced by the manufacturer including operating fluids, toilet and galley water plus all required equipment plus unusable fuel.
Is usually the mass of the basic aeroplane without any operating fluids.
Is the mass of an aeroplane including operating fluids, toilet and galley water and fuel.

 Determine the moment of Basic Empty Mass of the aeroplane.

the actual Take-off Mass, minus Traffic Load.
Dry Operating Mass minus Traffic Load.

B2HVqFXa.question: The Basic Empty Mass (BEM) is the:

options.text: Operating mass minus the crew and fuel load.
Landing mass minus the traffic load.

NZCD5UGE.question:
With the reference to mass and balance calculations (on an aeroplane) a datum point is used
This datum point is

options.text: a fixed point from which all balance arms are measured. It may be located anywhere on the aeroplane’s longitudinal axis or on the extensions to that axis
a point from which balance arms are measured. the location of this point varies with the distibution of loads on the aeroplane
the point through which the sum of mass values (of the aeroplane and its contents) is assumed to act vertically
a point near the centre of the aeroplane .It moves longitudinally as masses are added forward and aft its location

options.text: Forward centre of gravity limit will be exceeded.

options.text: The range increases with the aft CG movement.

aXByGCdO.question: The moment for an item is:

options.text: the mass of the item multiplied by its distance from the datum.
the square of the distance the item is from the datum divided by its mass.
the distance the item is from the datum divided by its mass.

 Pilot and front seat occupant: 80 kg each

options.text: If fuel becomes trapped in this location then an out of CG limit situation may develop.
A much increased work load for the flight crew.
Complicated pre-flight paper work, when completing the load and trim sheet.

OK2KU2tb.question: Where may an aircraft be weighed?

consists of defining the centre of gravity longitudinally in relation to the position of the aerodynamic centre of pressure.
consists of defining the centre of gravity longitudinally in relation to the length of the Mean Aerodynamic Chord and the trailing edge.

options.text: aft or forward, depending on the number of engines fitted.

At the top of descent (TOD), all the fuel in the central tank is consumed; the TOD CG position compared to that of the top of climb will be...

options.text: aft or forward, depending on the number of engines fitted.

SEjFc8Mt.question: Which section of the Aircraft Flight Manual describes the Centre of Gravity limits of the aircraft?

It has to be reweighed in 6 years time.

When must the operator ensure an aircraft is weighed?1) On initial entry into service.
